### Monte Carlo Tree Search for Code Generation using LLMs 
[__blog__](/blog/mcts) • [__github__](https://github.com/rmshin/llm-mcts)

We combine a pre-trained transformer model, referred to as deepseek-coder, with an adapted version of the Monte-Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) algorithm to guide the generation of code solutions for HumanEval and VerilogEval. 

### GPTX: A simple implementation of GPT-2 in Rust and CPP on CPU 
[__blog__](/blog/gptx) • [__github__](https://github.com/arunpatro/gptx)

Exploring the multiprocessing capabilities of Rust and C++ by comparing simple implementations of GPT-2 using Rust+Rayon, and C++ with OpenMP libraries. 

### Three problems to motivate Bayesian Machine Learning 
[__blog__](/blog/bayes-intro)

Reflecting on Andrew Wilson's course on Bayesian ML, I discuss the impact of probabilistic thinking and bayesian model averaging through the lens of solving three key problems using a Bayesian framework.

### Benchmarking Rust vs. CPP for graphics
[__blog__](/blog/graphics) • [__github__](https://github.com/arunpatro/raybench)

I discuss the performance of Rust compared to C++ in implementing three graphics programs, demonstrating Rust's superior performance on CPU-only tests. 

### An intuitive guide to solving a Rubik's cube using only 1 algorithm 
[__blog__](/blog/rubiks)

I explore the Old Pochmann method, a popular technique for solving Rubik's cubes blindfolded, and demonstrate how it can be effectively executed using a single algorithm.

### Thoughts on building a theoretical Clash Royale AI 
[__blog__](/blog/crai)

Exploring Clash Royale as a modern computational challenge like chess, I discuss the development of an AI using Reinforcement Learning to navigate and potentially master this game.
